title: 30 Items I'm Eyeing From Revolve, Zara, and Mango for 2025
text: As we enter the new year, I—like a lot of people—am in the process of cleaning out my closet. I'm taking inventory of what I have and what I actually wear and removing the items I don't. I typically do this twice a year to declutter and ensure I'm only holding on to pieces I actually love, giving me a clean slate to build out my wardrobe for the season ahead. Going through my closet also brings me back to my personal style, which allows me to examine upcoming trends through that lens before making any purchases.Since I'm feeling grounded in my personal style at the moment, I looked through the spring/summer 2025 runway shows to see which trends truly speak to me—Khaite's powder pink, Gucci's olive green, Saint Laurent's soft power suiting, and the romantic touches from Chloé have my full attention. With that in mind, I started browsing my favorite retailers and saving items I'm considering to build out my wardrobe for the year ahead. From powder-pink outerwear to relaxed tailoring and chic scarf details, the pieces I'm eyeing are a mix of new trends and timeless staples to round out my wardrobe. Below, I'm sharing the best shopping picks from Revolve, Zara, and Mango for 2025 (in my humble opinion). Camila Coelho Pauline Mock Neck Sweater The perfect shade of pink. Camila Coelho Solena Mini Skirt You must add the matching skirt. Camila Coelho Haliee Coat The coat is also a dream. ZARA Short Knit Scarf Coat Scarf details will continue to trend, and I think they add a sophisticated touch. This has a built-in scarf, and it's in olive green. MANGO Double-Breasted Virgin Wool Coat I can't resist this collar. A nod to the soft power trend. ZARA Square Toe Leather Shoes Peep-toe pumps are getting a modern update in 2025, and I'm on board. Romantic details were all over the spring runways, and this dress is perfection. Another very good blazer. Helsa Silk Tunic With Detachable Scarf Pantone named this the color of 2025. Elisa Johnson Avery Optical Eyeglasses Optical frames were all over the Saint Laurent runway. MANGO Structured Straight-Fit Blazer I love the relaxed tailoring. Adrienne Landau The Pamela Faux Fur Coat Leopard is having a resurgence, and I personally love it in outerwear form. Amanda Uprichard X Revolve Evianna Top How chic is this draping? East-west bags are going to continue to trend, and this Freja iteration is so chic. MANGO High Neck Wool Blend Coat I'm still not over funnel-neck outerwear. Camila Coelho Gurina Skirt Mocha Mousse is the color of the year, after all. MANGO Leopard Fur Leather Belt For just a touch of animal print. L'AGENCE Scotly Lace Trim Midi Dress Prepare to see lace slip dresses everywhere. MANGO Double-Breasted Wool Coat The high-neck silhouette is just so polished. SER.O.YA Grenache Satin Maxi Dress Enza Costa Everywhere Pant I've heard nothing but rave reviews about these pants, and I think this is the year I finally jump on the bandwagon. A suede trench is a timeless choice. ZARA Lace Satin Effect Dress I love the color-blocking on this one. MANGO Turtleneck Wool Coat I'm very into polished outerwear at the moment. MANGO Wideleg Suit Trousers The relaxed tailoring feels fresh. Explore More: Revolve Mango Zara
html:
As we enter the new year, I—like a lot of people—am in the process of cleaning out my closet. I'm taking inventory of what I have and what I actually wear and removing the items I don't. I typically do this twice a year to declutter and ensure I'm only holding on to pieces I actually love, giving me a clean slate to build out my wardrobe for the season ahead. Going through my closet also brings me back to my personal style, which allows me to examine upcoming trends through that lens before making any purchases.

Since I'm feeling grounded in my personal style at the moment, I looked through the spring/summer 2025 runway shows to see which trends truly speak to me—Khaite's powder pink, Gucci's olive green, Saint Laurent's soft power suiting, and the romantic touches from Chloé have my full attention. With that in mind, I started browsing my favorite retailers and saving items I'm considering to build out my wardrobe for the year ahead. From powder-pink outerwear to relaxed tailoring and chic scarf details, the pieces I'm eyeing are a mix of new trends and timeless staples to round out my wardrobe. Below, I'm sharing the best shopping picks from Revolve, Zara, and Mango for 2025 (in my humble opinion).

Camila Coelho

Pauline Mock Neck Sweater

The perfect shade of pink.

Camila Coelho

Solena Mini Skirt

You must add the matching skirt.

Camila Coelho

Haliee Coat

The coat is also a dream.

ZARA

Short Knit Scarf Coat

Scarf details will continue to trend, and I think they add a sophisticated touch.

This has a built-in scarf, and it's in olive green.

MANGO

Double-Breasted Virgin Wool Coat

I can't resist this collar.

A nod to the soft power trend.

ZARA

Square Toe Leather Shoes

Peep-toe pumps are getting a modern update in 2025, and I'm on board.

Romantic details were all over the spring runways, and this dress is perfection.

Another very good blazer.

Helsa

Silk Tunic With Detachable Scarf

Pantone named this the color of 2025.

Elisa Johnson

Avery Optical Eyeglasses

Optical frames were all over the Saint Laurent runway.

MANGO

Structured Straight-Fit Blazer

I love the relaxed tailoring.

Adrienne Landau

The Pamela Faux Fur Coat

Leopard is having a resurgence, and I personally love it in outerwear form.

Amanda Uprichard X Revolve

Evianna Top

How chic is this draping?

East-west bags are going to continue to trend, and this Freja iteration is so chic.

MANGO

High Neck Wool Blend Coat

I'm still not over funnel-neck outerwear.

Camila Coelho

Gurina Skirt

Mocha Mousse is the color of the year, after all.

MANGO

Leopard Fur Leather Belt

For just a touch of animal print.

L'AGENCE

Scotly Lace Trim Midi Dress

Prepare to see lace slip dresses everywhere.

MANGO

Double-Breasted Wool Coat

The high-neck silhouette is just so polished.

SER.O.YA

Grenache Satin Maxi Dress

Enza Costa

Everywhere Pant

I've heard nothing but rave reviews about these pants, and I think this is the year I finally jump on the bandwagon.

A suede trench is a timeless choice.

ZARA

Lace Satin Effect Dress

I love the color-blocking on this one.

MANGO

Turtleneck Wool Coat

I'm very into polished outerwear at the moment.

The relaxed tailoring feels fresh.
